item.title: NYC mayoral candidate wants to cut $1 billion from police. Pays for private security on her block...
item.description:
www.nydailynews.com
When Maya Wiley, the civil rights attorney and former de Blasio counsel who’s running for mayor, put out her first big position paper earlier this month, a gun violence prevention plan, what stood out was what wasn’t there: any productive role for the NYPD.

item.title: Alzheimer's Drug Poses Dilemma for FDA...
item.description:
www.msn.com
The Food and Drug Administration is on the verge of announcing one of its most contentious decisions in years: the fate of an Alzheimer’s drug that could be the first treatment approved after nearly two decades of failed efforts to find ways to curb the debilitating disease.

item.title: 600+ quakes shake California-Mexico border...
item.description:
www.cnn.com
More than 600 small earthquakes have been recorded this weekend in a rural area near the Salton Sea in Southern California, with the largest having a magnitude of 5.3, a US Geological Survey geophysicist told CNN.

item.title: Woman reveals dark hobby of seducing infamous serial killers by mail...
item.description:
nypost.com
Inside the shocking letters a couple traded with serial murderers including John Wayne Gacy, Jeffrey Dahmer and Richard “Night Stalker” Ramirez.

item.title: Supremes asked to review men-only draft law...
item.description:
apnews.com
WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court is being asked to decide whether it's sex discrimination for the government to require only men to register for the draft when they turn 18. The question of whether it's unconstitutional to require men but not women to register could be viewed as one with little practical impact.

item.title: Top scientist being hunted by far-right sniper who has gone AWOL from army...
item.description:
www.msn.com
Scientist Marc Van Ranst is in hiding with his family in a safe house with 24-hour security after a far-right sniper staked out his home.

item.title: 'WORST ELECTION DECEPTION'
item.description: www.jpost.com

item.title: Some hospitals mark first time being Covid-free...
item.description:
www.cnn.com
Dr. Raul Magadia and his team all gathered in the basement of their Anniston, Alabama, hospital last month for a big announcement he was preparing to make through the intercom system.

item.title: El Salvador looks to become world's first country to adopt crypto as legal tender...
item.description:
www.cnbc.com
El Salvador President Nayib Bukele plans to introduce legislation that will make it the world's first sovereign nation to adopt bitcoin as legal tender.

item.title: DOJ says it'll no longer seize reporters' records...
item.description:
apnews.com
WASHINGTON (AP) — The Justice Department said Saturday that it no longer will secretly obtain reporters' records during leak investigations , a policy shift that abandons a practice decried by news organizations and press freedom groups.

item.title: Pentagon Maintains Ban On Pride Flag...
item.description:
www.npr.org
The DOD restricted what flags could and couldn't be flown on military installations last July. The Pentagon considered making a special case for Pride Month, but decided against the exception.

item.title: Israeli security chief warns of Jan. 6-type ahead of Bibi departure...
item.description:
www.axios.com
The Shin Bet director raised concerns about “serious radicalization in incitement and discourse on social media.”

item.title: AL JAZEERA: Reporter forcefully detained...
item.description:
apnews.com
JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli police arrested a Palestinian protest leader in the contested Sheikh Jarrah neighborhood of Jerusalem on Sunday, a day after forcefully detaining a prominent Al Jazeera journalist covering the campaign by Jewish settlers to evict dozens of Palestinian families from the area.

item.title: Back on stage, Trump airs conspiracies and flirts with '24 run...
item.description:
www.france24.com
Back on stage, Trump airs conspiracies and flirts with 2024 run

item.title: Rahm ejected from PGA tournament with 6 shot lead because he tested positive for Covid...
item.description:
www.dailymail.co.uk
The Spaniard had hit an incredible 64 to put himself in pole position to take home the £1.2million prize money but his test result means he now has to pull out of the competition.

item.title: Nevada law bans racially discriminatory school mascots, 'sundown sirens'...
item.description:
www.cnn.com
The state of Nevada is banning "racially discriminatory" school mascots after legislation was signed into law on Friday, as well as banning town sirens historically used to discriminate.

item.title: Massive fire in Phoenix spurs 'largest response' in Fire Dept history...
item.description:
www.azcentral.com
The fire started near 35th Avenue and Lincoln Street, the Phoenix Fire Department said. 35th Avenue from Buckeye Road to Van Buren Street were closed.

item.title: Rahm told he has Covid on live TV - while leading PGA event...
item.description:
www.theguardian.com
The Spaniard was forced to withdraw with a six-shot lead and close to joining Tiger Woods as the only repeat winners of the Memorial

item.title: IRS sending out 4th stimulus check by mistake?
item.description:
www.the-sun.com
MILLIONS of Americans have received their third stimulus checks, but some fourth relief payments have been sent out by mistake. The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) mistakenly sent out some additiona…

futurism.com
We might be headed towards a "summer of sex."

item.title: He's running for mayor of Mexican city. He's also wanted by DEA...
item.description:
www.msn.com
Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador won the presidency on promises to fight corruption. But as his party has grown, so have its own scandals.

item.title: 'ANONYMOUS' threatens Musk for manipulating Bitcoin...
item.description:
www.dailymail.co.uk
The 'hacktivist' group Anonymous have recorded a message aimed at Elon Musk. The group express their frustration with the Tesla CEO over his 'cavalier attitude' to cryptocurrency.

item.title: SUIT: School principal made employee take raunchy pics...
item.description:
nypost.com
Gisselle Vasquez, a 35-year-old single mom, was hired as a Spanish-speaking secretary for Principal Evelina Medina at the Robert C. Dodson School.
